content.description: Sit-start left of the tree on a large flake.  Move up to a thumb-catch then follow a left leaning corner to a less than vertical (and a bit scary) top-out
content.location: Hank's Boulder 2ft left of the tree.

content.description:
Per

Darren Wong

200243938

: this boulder has tipped over recently!

Location: on Hank's Boulder. See "

Hank's Lunge

" for more detail on finding boulder.

This problem starts low on the black face and climbs the crimps that are directly right of an arete. Scarface is left of the problem "

Fuck You Finger

" which climbs black face to the two obvious slopers 7 feet up the wall.

Start sitdown with right hand on small crimp. Move left and up to more crimps, to sloping lip, and then up and right to decent hold. Topout and descend tree.

This is a great, little, granite, crimper problem.

Start the same as

Scarface

. Make your first move out left to a crimp before moving back right to a very small right hand crimp in the middle of the face. Continue straight up the face finishing on the Sloper Jumpstart.

Several broken holds have bumped the grade down some over the years.
content.location: This is on Hanks Boulder. Can't....

content.description:
This is located on the Hank's Boulder.  It the left arete you see as you approach the boulder from the parking. One Ton Ho is just left of

Scarface

.

Sitdown start, head up to gain a fairly good flat edge on the arete, then traverse right along the sloping lip until you reach the finishing jugs on

Scarface

.
content.protection: A pad, it has a flat landing.

content.description:
Location: On Hank's Boulder, which is the first boulder along the dirt road as you approach the 420 Boulders.  There is a single ponderosa pine at one end of the boulder which is used for the descent (it has huge nails pounded in it - I don't think climbers did it).  Problem is alone on the white north face (pine tree directly to your right).

Start with right hand on obvious sidepull in middle of face.  May be hard to reach if you're short.  Delicate footwork will get you onto the face.  Move up and go for the lip.

This grade is only an estimate.

Per

Ben Scott

: this problem no longer exists. Hanks Boulder fell over in May 2018.

Directions: On Hank's Boulder, see approach info for the route "

Hank's Lunge

".

The arete right of "

Fuck You Finger

" and left of "

Hank's Lunge

". Short little problem but great fun. Start sitting with hands bearhugging the arete.

Located on the Hank's Boulder, between

Scarface

and

Hank's Arete

.  Start low on a good sidepull crimp with your right hand and the left hand uses one of the starting edges of Scarface.  Move straight up to incredibly small crimps on the black face and then to the sloper rail.

Skipping the start by jumping from the ground to the sloper rail makes this a fun V3.

As seen in SoLuTiOnS... run and jump off the small rock, and grab the lip of Hank's Boulder near the topout of

One Ton Ho

.
content.location:
This is left of

One Ton Ho

on Hank's Boulder.
